title: 13 Natural Energy Drinks You Can Make at Home
author: Lisa Marie Conklin Updated May
description: Feeling like a slug every afternoon? Instead of another cup of plain coffee, try a natural energy drinks for a healthy boost of energy.
cleaned_text: 13 Natural Energy Drinks You Can Make at Home Feeling like a slug every afternoon? Instead of grabbing another cup of coffee, make one of these natural energy drinks for a healthy boost of energy—and some nifty health benefits to boot! Sweet potato breakfast smoothie A leftover sweet potato from dinner gives you a head start for this natural energy drink that jump-starts your day. "Sweet potatoes contain carbohydrates and fiber that provide long-lasting energy along with vitamins A and C," says [Bonnie Taub-Dix](https://bonnietaubdix.com/about/), RDN, author of [Read It Before You Eat It](https://www.amazon.com/Read-Before-You-Eat-Taking/dp/1979739722/?tag=healthtmb-20). Ingredients: 1/2 medium baked sweet potato 1/2 cup plain 0% fat Greek yogurt 1/2 cup [almond milk](https://www.thehealthy.com/nutrition/benefits-of-almond-milk/) 1/2 banana 1 teaspoon ground sweetened cocoa powder 1 teaspoon chia seeds 3 ice cubes Directions: Blend ingredients in a blender on high. Makes 3 cups. Dr. Green Detox Smoothie for Energy "When you need a real power punch of energy and cleansing vitality, you can't do better than a straight-up green smoothie," says chiropractor [Daryl "Dr. Green" Gioffre](https://www.gioffrechiropractic.com/meet-the-doctor/), founder of the Gioffre Chiropractic Wellness Center in New York, NY, and author of [Get Off Your Acid.](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/0738219924?tag=healthtmb-20) Be sure to check out these [31 energy boosters](https://www.thehealthy.com/fatigue/surprising-energy-boosters/) that aren't coffee. Ingredients: 1 handful of spinach 1/2 lemon, peeled 1-inch ginger, fresh 1/2 cucumber, peeled 1 small handful of cilantro 1 small handful of parsley 1 cup coconut water (or filtered water) Optional: organic stevia or 1 date, handful of ice Directions: Blend ingredients. Matcha Collagen Energy Booster This natural energy drink provides a boost of energy and focus. "The matcha contains just about as much caffeine as a cup of coffee, but you'll start to feel a relaxed yet focused state of mind," says [Maggie Michalczyk](https://www.onceuponapumpkinrd.com/meetmaggie/), RDN, a registered dietitian nutritionist in Chicago, IL. "Matcha contains the amino acid called L-theanine, which produces an alert calmness." This is processed slower in the body, so you're not bouncing off the walls and crashing later. Check out these [quick ways to boost energy](https://www.thehealthy.com/fatigue/energy-boost/) if you're feeling drained. Ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk 1 1/2 tsp peptides](https://www.thehealthy.com/skin-health/collagen-powder-benefits/) Directions: Heat almond milk. Add matcha powder and collagen to an 8-ounce mug. Pour heated milk over powders, and stir. Mix in a blender for a frothier drink. For a touch of sweetness add 1/2 teaspoon honey. Kombucha Energy Tea " [Kombucha](https://www.thehealthy.com/food/kombucha-benefits/) is a refreshing and healthy drink that contains probiotics, vitamin B12, butyrate (a fatty acid), and vitamin K2. Vitamin B12 is known to increase energy levels and contributes to an overall mental well being," says [Rebecca Park](https://www.remediesforme.com/about/), RN, a registered nurse in New York, NY and founder of Remedies for Me. Ingredients: 2 gallons water 8 black tea bags 1 1/2 cups organic sugar Directions: Heat 2 gallons of water in a big pot with 8 black tea bags. Add 1-1/2 cup of organic sugar to the tea and boil for about 15 minutes on low heat. Turn the heat off and let liquid cool completely. Once cooled, carefully pour the tea into a glass jar that contains the Scoby. Place a coffee filter or paper towel over the top of the jar and keep closed with a rubber band. Let it sit in a warm place out of direct sunlight for about seven to 10 days. Apple-Banana Energy Shake If you're feeling like a slug in the afternoon, pass on the soda and blend this natural energy drink instead. "Apples are a great source of both long-term and short-term energy. Besides being rich in antioxidants, apples contain natural vitamins and sugars that are slowly released throughout the body," says [Caleb Backe](https://www.mapleholistics.com/team/), a New York, NY-based certified personal trainer and health and wellness expert for Maple Holistics. "Peanut butter is an excellent source of healthy fats and proteins which not only fight off hunger but also store energy and balance blood sugar levels." Choose natural peanut butter without added sugar or hydrogenated oils as these can up inflammation. Here are some tips for [energy after lunch.](https://www.thehealthy.com/nutrition/energy-after-lunch/) Ingredients: 2 medium-sized apples, peeled 2 frozen bananas 3-4 dates 1/4 cup milk 2 tablespoons of nut butter 1/2 cup crushed ice Directions: Combine all of the ingredients in a blender until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve chilled. Berry Matcha Energy Drink "This drink is great for the mornings or for an afternoon pick-me-up," says [Cassandra Suarez](https://www.cassandrasuareznutrition.com/), RDN, a registered dietitian nutritionist in Charlotte, NC. "Berries contain natural sugars, which don't spike your blood sugar and slowly release the energy throughout the whole day." Ingredients: 1 cup frozen berries 2 teaspoon matcha Juice of 1 lime 1 cup filtered water Directions: Blend all ingredients. Watermelon Smoothie The secret of this energy drink is the green coffee bean extract. "Green coffee bean extract has been shown to exhibit incredible health benefits including rich antioxidants, specifically 100 percent pure chlorogenic acid (a substance in green coffee beans), which aids in the suppression of appetite, reduction of free radicals, improves cholesterol levels, and various other anti-aging properties associated with longevity," says [Melissa Rifkin](https://www.melissarifkinnutrition.com/), RD, a registered dietitian in New York, NY. Always hungry? Check out these [natural appetite suppressants](https://www.thehealthy.com/weight-loss/natural-appetite-suppressants/). Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups lemonade 2 cups watermelon 1 cup frozen strawberries 1/2 lime squeezed 1 [Mixed Berry pureLYFT](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B06XQ3CZSK/?tag=healthtmb-20) (green coffee bean extract) Directions: Blend ingredient. Berry-Cherry Energy Drink "The coconut water is a source of potassium and tart cherry juice not only adds an amazing flavor, it's rich in compounds called polyphenols that act as antioxidants and are anti-inflammatory as well," says [Susan Bowerman](https://discovergoodnutrition.com/nutrition-fitness/susan-bowerman-2/), RD, a registered dietitian and specialist in sports dietetics. Find out the daily habits of people who have [a lot of energy](https://www.rd.com/health/wellness/habits-people-lot-of-energy). Ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon [Herbalife Pomegranate Green Tea](https://www.amazon.com/Herbalife-Concentrate-Lemon-Flavor-1-8oz/dp/B005MT1D6E/?th=1%3F?tag=healthtmb-20) 3/4 cup coconut water 1/4 cup tart cherry juice 1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric Handful of fresh strawberries or raspberries Lemon slices Directions: Combine tea, coconut water, cherry juice and turmeric in a shaker bottle and shake until well mixed. Add fruit and lemon slices. Chai Smoothie with Spirulina " [Spirulina](https://www.thehealthy.com/nutrition/spirulina-benefits/) boosts energy by way of its massive nutrient-density, which includes complete protein, full-spectrum B-vitamins, and detoxifying [chlorophyll](https://www.thehealthy.com/nutrition/vitamins/chlorophyll/)," says Los Angeles, CA-based [Julie natural chef and author Ingredients: 3 tablespoons raw cashews 2 Medjool dates, pitted 2 tablespoons cacao nibs 1 tablespoon chia seeds 2 teaspoons [maca powder](https://www.thehealthy.com/alternative-medicine/maca-root-powder/) 1/4 teaspoons Hawaiian Spirulina powder 1 teaspoon cinnamon powder 1 teaspoon ginger powder 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder 2 cups coconut water 1 frozen banana 1 1/2 cups ice Sweetener (optional) Directions: Blend all the ingredients, except the frozen banana and ice, until smooth. Add the remaining ingredients and blend again until frosty. Sweeten to taste. Moroccan Mint Tea Refresher "You'll feel refreshed and rejuvenated after drinking this invigorating mint, vitamin-C rich lemon, and antioxidant-packed tea," says [Rachel Swanson](https://www.lifespanmedicine.com/our-team), RD, a nutritionist at LifeSpan. Ingredients: 1 cup brewed tea (cold) green tea, white tea, or mint tea 1 cup cold water 1 glass of ice 1 whole lemon, freshly squeezed Several springs of fresh mint Directions: Place all ingredients in a cocktail shaker to combine. Shake well. Golden Milk Latte It seems by 3 p.m., our energy and brain fizzle out. Cozy up to this energy latte instead of another cup of java to get an energizing immunity boost without caffeine, says [Katie Hake](https://www.katiehake.com/about), RDN, a registered dietitian nutritionist in Indianapolis, IN. "The combination of turmeric and ginger will provide a calm yet energizing boost." Here are some more healthy [eating habits for more energy](https://www.thehealthy.com/fatigue/healthy-eating-habits-for-more-energy/). Ingredients: 1 cup milk of choice 1/2 teaspoon turmeric 1/2 teaspoon [cinnamon](https://www.thehealthy.com/nutrition/what-is-cinnamon-good-for/) Pinch of black pepper 1/8 teaspoon ginger powder (or tiny piece of fresh peeled ginger) Pinch of cayenne pepper 1/2 teaspoon raw honey to taste. Directions: Blend together in saucepan over heat (or in a microwave-safe bowl) until hot, but not boiling. Pour into mug. Coconut Matcha Energy Drink Dehydration can [zap energy](https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/dehydration/symptoms-causes/syc-20354086) and make you feel tired. This natural energy drink is a thirst quencher that is also low in calories. "It is slightly sweet and helps balance electrolytes with more potassium than four bananas," notes [Grace Derocha](http://www.ahealthiermichigan.org/about/our-team/about-grace-arriola-derocha/), RD, a registered dietitian with Blue Cross Blue Shield of Michigan. Ingredients: 1 cup coconut water 2 teaspoons matcha powder Garnish with slice of orange Optional: serve on ice Directions: Mix coconut water and matcha powder. Stir until fully combined. Garnish with orange slice. Dirty Matcha A shot of espresso and matcha aren't the only players in this energy drink. The added dates are rich in protein and B vitamins, which may assist in boosting energy, while the cinnamon invigorates blood, which may helps with energy and mood, says [Mona Dan](https://www.viehealing.com/about-mona-dan), founder of Vie Healing in Los Angeles, CA. Just be sure to drink this before 2 p.m. to avoid being wide awake at bedtime. Don't miss these [natural energy boosters](https://www.thehealthy.com/nutrition/natural-energy-boosters/) that might change your life. Ingredients: 1 teaspoon powdered matcha 1/2 cup boiling water 1/2 cup cashew or almond milk 1 date, finely chopped 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon 1 shot espresso 1/4 teaspoon honey (optional) Directions: Whisk matcha with enough boiling water to dissolve. Add remaining water. Boil date, honey, and cinnamon in milk, until frothy. Strain or blend milk mixture. Pour frothy milk on top of matcha in cup. Add a shot of espresso and sweeten to taste.
